results.doc_title: Scope Proposal: External Engineering Augmentation for The Pets Table (TPT)
results.project_name: External Engineering Augmentation for The Pets Table (TPT)
results.summary: External engineering augmentation project for The Pets Table (TPT) focusing on three main initiatives: creating a checkout confirmation page with multipet and add-ons versions, improving dashboard quick actions with above-fold repositioning, and optimizing meal display on the dashboard. All deliverables must be delivered for Web and Mobile Web, fully tested, integrated into existing tech stack, with documentation and editable content through Contentful.

must_have: Two versions of checkout confirmation page (multipet and add-ons)
Order summary display matching checkout page
Logic-based page loading to show correct version based on pet profile data
Remove 'frying pan' animation from current production flow
Redesigned quick actions placed above the fold as accordion
Header formatted to new design (UI changes only)
View order total button changed to icon on mobile
Two CTAs below meals: change meals and feeding guide
Reduced size of meals display on dashboard
Portion percentage functionality with multiple calorie ranges (100%, 75%, 50%)
Two API calls for switching portion percentage: patch subscription and patch pet profile
Portion % hook, badge, and quiz steps components
All content editable through Contentful entries
Full testing and integration into existing tech stack
nice_to_have: Quiz Allergens experiment setup repurposed for new experiment

decisions.what: Remove frying pan animation from checkout flow
decisions.rationale: Current animation gives impression that user needs to cook the food, which is misleading

decisions.what: Show multipet CTA if user mentioned multiple pets in checkout, otherwise show add-ons store CTA
decisions.rationale: Personalize post-conversion experience based on user's pet profile to increase add-ons take rate and multipet penetration

decisions.what: Move quick actions above the fold as accordion
decisions.rationale: Active users struggling to navigate to features they need; current placement at bottom of page reduces discoverability

decisions.what: Implement portion percentage logic in FE for mixed plans
decisions.rationale: API returns mixed plan for 50/75% portions, requiring frontend handling

success_metrics: Increased user engagement with core functionalities
Mitigating the need of churning and improved retention
Optimized display of meal information reducing page real estate

entities.role: API handling calorie range logic for portion percentages
